data.fullContent: The Italian Renaissance (literally, 'rebirth') was a period of European history that spanned the late 1400s and early 1500s. As with the other European Renaissance periods, which occurred in different fields of study at different times in the western world, Italian Renaissance art and architecture changed the way people thought about and applied beauty. During this period, artists and architects studied classical Greek and Roman works, especially the architecture of Greco-Roman buildings. The Renaissance architects applied classical elements to their own designs, thus creating modern classical architecture. In the 16th century, European architects also paid attention to classic Roman facades, columns, and archways and adapted them to suit their own tastes.

q1.translation: 意大利文艺复兴(字面意思是“重生”)是欧洲历史上跨越15世纪末和16世纪初的一段时期。和其他欧洲文艺复兴时期一样，意大利文艺复兴时期的艺术和建筑也改变了人们对美的思考和应用方式。
q1.front: The Italian Renaissance (literally, 'rebirth') was a period of European history that spanned the late 1400s and early 1500s. As with the other European Renaissance periods, which occurred in different fields of study at different times in the western world, Italian Renaissance art and architecture changed the way people thought about and applied beauty.
q1.content: The Italian Renaissance (literally, 'rebirth') was a ____ of European history that spanned the late 1400s and ____ 1500s. As with the ____ European Renaissance periods, which occurred in different fields of study at ____ times in the western ____, Italian Renaissance ____ and architecture changed the ____ people thought about and applied beauty.

q2.translation: 意大利文艺复兴(字面意思是“重生”)是欧洲历史上跨越15世纪末和16世纪初的一段时期。和其他欧洲文艺复兴时期一样，意大利文艺复兴时期的艺术和建筑也改变了人们对美的思考和应用方式。在这一时期，艺术家和建筑师研究了古典希腊和罗马的作品，特别是希腊罗马建筑。文艺复兴时期的建筑师在自己的设计中运用了古典元素，从而创造了现代古典建筑。在16世纪，欧洲的建筑师也注意到经典的罗马立面、圆柱和拱门，并将它们加以改造以适应他们自己的品味。
q2.front: The Italian Renaissance (literally, 'rebirth') was a period of European history that spanned the late 1400s and early 1500s. As with the other European Renaissance periods, which occurred in different fields of study at different times in the western world, Italian Renaissance art and architecture changed the way people thought about and applied beauty.
q2.middle: During this period, artists and architects studied classical Greek and Roman works, especially the architecture of Greco-Roman buildings.
q2.ending: The Renaissance architects applied classical elements to their own designs, thus creating modern classical architecture. In the 16th century, European architects also paid attention to classic Roman facades, columns, and archways and adapted them to suit their own tastes.

options.sentence: Interior design is the art of creating a functional and pleasing environment for people, spaces, and functions.
The Renaissance and modern interior design are a product of the humanist movement that occurred during the 14th and 15th centuries.
Architects followed these principles in designing their buildings, including the layout and placement of the rooms within the building.
During this period, artists and architects studied classical Greek and Roman works, especially the architecture of Greco-Roman buildings.

options.sentence: Decorative art was used to beautify homes with works of art, furniture, paintings, tapestries, and wall hangings.
Many of these designs were very basic because they were mainly used for practical purposes rather than for looks.
During the Italian Renaissance, architects incorporated classic elements into their designs in order to create modern classical architecture.
The degree of influence is greater for architectural elements than interiors, which are more decorative than functional.
